MUXB 1 bits

Select the denied condition or condition as the input value for A1:

B

MUXC (MuxC3-MuxC0)

C


MR 1 bits

It allows to select the value for RA, RB and RC. If MR equals 1 then the SELA value will represent the register id. of the register file that you want to use:

Figure 20 Details of management signals RA, RB and RC

If MR equals 0 then the SELA value represents the offset within the instruction register from which 5 bits are taken, and the value of those 5 bits is the identifier of the register in the register file:

Figure 20Details of management signals RA, RB and RC

The central processing unit: ALU

MA 1 bits

Select which value to use as operator A in the ALU:

MA

Selection

0

Selection given by signal RA

1

Value contained in the RT1 register

MB 2 bits

Select which value will be used as operator B in the ALU:

MB

Selection

00

Selection given by RB signal

01

Value contained inside RT2 register

10

4 value

11

1 value


COP 4 bits

Select the operation that is performed in the ALU:

COP (C0P3-C0P0)

Operation

0000

A and B

A or B

0011

not (A)

A xor B

Rotate Left (A)

1011

1101

1110

A % B (integer division)

(A << 16) & 0xFFFF0000

The central processing unit: State Register (SR)

SelP 2 bits

Select which bits will be updated in the status register:

M7

Selection

0

Internal Bus

1

Output selected by SelP

The central processing unit: Instruction Record (IR)

SE 1 bits

SIZE 5 bits

OFFSET 5 bits

They allow to select a bits section contained in the instruction register to be dumped into the internal bus.

The central processing unit: main memory access

BE 4 bits

Entry control signals of the main memory.

BE3=BW1, BE2=BW0, BE1=A1, BE0=A0

Byte 3

Byte 2

Byte 1

Byte 0

M1 1 bits

They allow you to select which value can be used to update the data register (MBR): with the value from memory or the value from the internal data bus.

The central processing unit: Bank of Records (RF).

RA 5 bits

RB 5 bits

RC 5 bits

LC 1 bits

They allow you to select a register which value goes to A (RA) or B (RB), or to update the value of the selected record (RC). In the case of updating the register, in addition to using the RC signal, use the LC signal with a value of 1.
It is NOT recommended to use directly RA, RB, and RC because its value is generated by using SelA (SelB, SelC) and MR.

Figure 9 Options available for the MUX A


The central processing unit: Program Counter (PC)

M2 1 bits

They allow you to select which value can be used to update the program counter register (PC): adding four to the current PC content or the value that comes from the internal data bus.

Figure 10 Detail of the PC register management options

The central processing unit: Registers

C0, ..., C7 1 bit

It will store in the associated register, the value from the input of the register at the end of the clock cycle.

The central processing unit: Access to the internal data bus

T1, ..., T11 1 bit

Copy the value in the input of the associated tri-state element into the internal data bus, during the clock cycle.

The central processing unit: The ALU flags, plus I and U flags

TEST_C, ..., TEST_U 1 bit

Let user to change on-the-fly the values of Carry-oVerflow-Negative-Zero-Int_enable-User_level flags as they were generated by the hardware elements.
